chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin E. Coppens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Neglecting a Child- DANE COUNTY, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor - COLUMBIA COUNTY, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colin E. Coppens

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

02:52 PM Defendant Colin E. Coppens in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Kenneth John Hamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also heard with 18CF83, 18CM42 & 18CF40
Atty Hamm states agreement to revoke DPA in 15CF28 and sentence defendant. Defendant also to enter plea to 18CF83 Ct 3 and 18CM42 Ct 2.  All other counts to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court grants revocation of the DPA in 15CF28 Cts 1, 5, 10 & 15.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to 18CF83 Ct 3 and 18CM42 Ct 2.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court questions Atty Johnson.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of 18CF83 Ct 3 and 18CM42 Ct 2.  All other counts in 18CF 83, 18CM42 and 18CF40 are ordered dismissed and read-in.
Atty Hamm makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  15CF28 Cts 1 & 5:  Court sentences defendant to 4 years in the Wisconsin Prison System with 2 years incarceration and 2 years extended supervision, concurrent to each other.  Sentence imposed and stayed and defendant is sentenced to probation for a period of 5 years with the following conditions:
*AODA and comply with any recommendations
*Maintain absolute sobriety, as to alcohol and controlled substances.
*Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*Pay costs in each count of $518, includes DNA surcharge
*Submit DNA sample
*Eligible for both the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program.

15CF28 Cts 10 & 15:  Court sentences defendant to 4 years in the Wisconsin Prison System with 2 years incarceration and 2 years extended supervision, concurrent to each other and consecutive to Cts 1 & 5.  Sentence imposed and stayed and defendant is sentenced to probation for a period of 5 years with the following conditions:
*Comply with all conditions in Cts 1 & 5
*Pay costs in each count of $518, includes DNA surcharge
*Submit DNA sample
*Eligible for both the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program.

18CF83 Ct 3:  Defendant sentenced to 8 months in the Marquette County Jail with huber, out-of-county travel.  Granted 6 days credit for time already served. Sentence to commence within 60 days.
*Pay costs 
*Submit DNA and pay costs.


18CM42 Ct 2:   Defendant sentenced to 90 days in the Marquette County Jail, sentence imposed and stayed and defendant is placed on probation for a period of 12 months with the following conditions:
*Pay costs
*Submit DNA sample and pay costs.

Any bond on file to be applied to any cases.

records.descr: Application for consolidation of criminal charges

records.addlTxt: TREATMENT COURT PLEA AGREEMENT

Defendant Colin E. Coppens in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Defendant Colin E. Coppens in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF28, 14CT86, 14CT76, 14TR1375 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the matters are resolved and also matters are resolved with other counties.
Atty Hendee files the new information with additional counts added from Dane County and Columbia County; for a total of 17 counts.   Atty Hendee states that the defendant has not waived his prelim.
    Atty Johnson states that the defendant would like to waive the Preliminary Hearing and proceed with the agreement today.  Atty Johnson has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Atty Johnson states that the Defendant received a copy of the new information and waives its reading.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1, 4, 5, 8, 10, 15 and 17.  Counts 2, 3, 6, 7, 9, 11, 12, 13, 14, 16, 14CT76 & 14CT86 to be dismissed and read-in.  15TR799:  Atty Hendee asks the court to find the refusal reasonable and will move to dismiss.  15TR698, 14TR1375, 15TR773 to be dismissed. 
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will be participating in the Treatment Court Program.  Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 36 months with conditions on Counts 1, 5, 10 & 15.  Atty Hendee states that the Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge is also in court today.
Atty Johnson agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of counts 4, 8 & 17.
Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 36 month DPA with conditions on Counts 1, 5, 10 & 15.
Counts 2, 3, 6, 7, 9, 11, 12, 13, 14, 16, 14CT76 & 14CT86 to be dismissed and read-in.
15TR799:  Court finds that the refusal was reasonable and will dismiss.
15TR698, 14TR1375, 15TR773 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee requests that any cash bond from other counties be transferred to Marquette County to be applied to an uncharged case with Restitution.
Atty Johnson agrees.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 1, 5, 10 & 15:  Court approves the 36 month DPA with conditions.
Counts 4, 8 & 17:  TREATMENT COURT:
Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail; all but 45 days imposed and stayed for use of the Treatment Court Program (On Count 17)
*Sentence to commence forthwith
*Successful participation and completion in the Marquette County Treatment Court Program
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Court Costs = $243.00 on all 3 counts
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge

*Credit for all cases = 147 days if revoked or the DPA is terminated
Bond from all cases to be applied to Restitution first and then to costs

Counts 2, 3, 6, 7, 9, 11, 12, 13, 14, 16, 14CT76 & 14CT86 to be dismissed and read-in.
15TR799:  Court finds that the refusal was reasonable and will dismiss.
15TR698, 14TR1375, 15TR773 to be dismissed.
